name: 英語會話（二）
comment: 建議修習輔系第一年時選修
goals: Acquire the attitude that is conducive to having English conversation.
Know the stages involved in the English conversation process.
Acquire the skills to open, sustain and close an English conversation.
Learn the vocabulary for topics commonly mentioned in daily conversations.
Acquire the skills to perform FTA’s (Face Threatening Acts) like requesting, rejecting a request, hiding true feelings, and deflecting embarrassing questions.
Learn how to conduct phone conversations.
Acquire the knowledge and ability to conduct conversations at a job interview.
syllabus:
**Objective:**  
Students will improve their ability to express their ideas and opinions clearly and coherently through preparing and presenting material on personal interests / experiences and current affairs for group discussions. Whenever appropriate students will draw on self-selected authentic materials.

Students will also be given instruction on how to improve their language skills, with particular emphasis on comprehensible input and autonomous learning.

**Schedule:**

The course is divided into three tasks with students being required to do one presentation per task. The tasks are:

Task One: ‘Two Sides of the Issue’

Students will be introduced to the basic skills needed to prepare and give an effective presentation on self-selected debate topics. The task involves engaging with the debate topics in small groups as well as follow-up discussions.

Task Two: ‘Teacher For A Day’

Students will work in groups to prepare and give a communicative language lesson in English. Instruction, examples and advice will be provided on communicative language learning, lesson planning and classroom management.

Task Three: ‘How To’

Students will work in groups to teach each other _‘how to’_ do skills that they themselves have mastered. Instruction, examples and advice will be provided on the language needed to complete this task successfully.

A tentative schedule will be drawn up during the first class of the semester as students are given dates on which to complete the three tasks.

**Class Activities:**

Lecturing / Presentations / Group and Class Discussions

grading.note: Two Sides, Teacher for a Day, How To

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
